title: [Backlog] Labeling Quality Expansion - Gold Standard on regular Tasks and Subset Repeated Tasks
body:
Context:
There are a variety of functions to measure data quality in general in Diffgram.
The Pipelines for example can be setup to "route" data. Also [exams](https://diffgram.readme.io/docs/exams-introduction) allows each user to annotate and then compare their work against a golden set.
[More on existing Data Quality Features](https://diffgram.readme.io/docs/measure-data-quality-annotations-more)

However, we don't specifically have the following features yet:

1) Generate a "Score" based on a "known good" reference set on new tasks.
Surface a score in a more "task manager level" way. eg "90% of the 5 known good samples were correct in the new batch".

For example, out of a set of 100 samples, 5 were prior completed and are deemed to be "correct". 
When those 5 get reviewed a second time, score how closely they relate to each other.
Core assumption here is the ability to declare beforehand which were correct.

2) Select only a subset of the batch to be completed multiple times. Then provide a score similar to the above mentioned example. This is the case where there is no "known good" provided before hand.

**Do you want this feature?** If so please place an emoji on this comment and add a comment describing your use case and more detail
